Hesam,

The Sourceforge repository goes  back only to version 1.4. I'll look  
and see if I can find an older version.

Some alternatives that might be of interest... Microsoft offers a  
free C++ compiler and development environment "Visual Studio  
Express".  I haven't tried it, but I've heard Cantera can be compiled  
with it.  Also, there are other free Fortran compilers for Windows,  
such as gfortran. Finally, another option would be to install the  
cygwin tools and build Cantera using g++.

Dave


On May 25, 2007, at 3:06 AM, Hesam wrote:

> Dear Prof. Goodwin
> Now I am using Compaq Visual Fortran 6.5 developing code for  
> combustion
> simulation in H2ICE (Hydrogen ICE). I have noticed Cantera 1.2 don't
> have any problem linking with that version of Fortran. Since currently
> I don't have any access to "visual studio .net " and Fortran's  
> compiler
> that can be linked with Cantera 1.7, Would you please help me to find
> Cantera 1.2 source files.
> Thank you in advance,
> Hesam
